Wind farms can cause local ecological impacts, including impacts on animal habitat and movements,
biological concerns, bird and bat fatalities from collisions with rotating blades,
. The impacts on animal habitats and collisions can be resolved or reduced
some wind turbines in high risk locations, often without affecting the
. Many countries now require environmental studies
of impacts of wind turbines on wildlife prior to project developme
nt, and, in some regions, shutdowns
are required during active bird migration
migratory birds and other sea species
Recent studies find weak associations between
for onshore and particularly offshore wind energy is generally high, although people
may oppose specific wind farm projects (
. People generally believe that wind energy is associated
with environmental benefits and that it is relatively cheap. Yet, some people believe wind turbines can
cause noise and visual aesthetic pollution, threaten
, and have adverse effects on wildlife
. Support for local wind projects is higher
. Evidence is mixed whether distance from wind turbines or financial compensation
increases public acceptability of wind turbines
(Hoen et al. 2019; Rand and Hoen 2017; Cass et al.
Offshore wind farms projects have higher
public support, but can also face
economic barriers to wind development are high initial cost of capital, long payback periods,
uate access to capital. Optimal wind energy expansion is most likely to occur in the presence
of a political commitment to establish, maintain, and improve financial support instruments,
efforts to support a local supply chains, and grid inve
Critical strategic minerals and a low
The secure supply of many metals and minerals (e.g., cobalt, copper, lithium, and rare earth elements,
REEs) is critical to supporting a
carbon energy system transition will increase the demand for these minerals to be used in technologies
d turbines, PV cells, and batteries
questions about possible constraints to a low
carbon energy system transition, including supply chain
). Concerns have also been raised about mining for these materials, which
frequently results in severe environmental impacts
energy depends on two critical REEs
es not use REEs but utilizes aluminium, copper, and
. Lithium, nickel, cobalt, and phosphorous are used in batteries. Many critical
inerals are used in EVs, including aluminium and copper in manufacturing the necessary EV charging
infrastructure, and neodymium in permanent magnet motors.
